title: Holly Willoughby SCREAMS and storms off set as Phillip Schofield scares her with a skeleton hand
text:
She is the popular This Morning presenter who is famously easily spooked.

And Holly Willoughby couldn't contain her horror as Phillip Schofield frightened her with a Halloween prop on Wednesday's episode of the hit show.

The TV beauty, 38, screamed before storming off set after Phil donned a fake skeleton hand and reached for her neck as she did a live link to Loose Women.

Scroll down for video

Fright night: Holly Willoughby couldn't contain her horror as Phillip Schofield frightened her with a Halloween prop on Wednesday's episode of the hit show

As the pair finished up a segment on the best Halloween costumes, a smiling Holly began speaking to the Loose ladies.

However as she spoke, a sinister Phil reached for her throat wearing a creepy grey skeleton hand.

A blissfully unaware Holly said: 'Hi ladies, what's got you talking to- DAY' before screaming as Phil cackled hysterically.

As the co-host, the crew and the Loose Women panel burst out laughing and said 'everytime!', a fuming Holly caught her breath.

Terrified: The TV beauty, 38, screamed before storming off set after Phil donned a fake skeleton hand and reached for her neck as she did a live link to Loose Women

Unware: As she did a live link to Loose Women, a sinister Phil reached for her throat wearing a creepy grey skeleton hand

She then jokingly stormed off the set, saying: 'Right, I'm coming to be a Loose Woman!'

Famous scaredy-cat Holly also revealed she had been left crying in the scene dock while filming the Halloween special of Celebrity Juice.

It comes after Holly and Phillip are reportedly set to net £150,000 for working an extra half an hour each day on This Morning from January.

Following the cancellation of The Jeremy Kyle Show, ITV are revamping their schedule and This Morning's airtime is being extended by thirty minutes.

According to the Daily Mirror, insiders have revealed an extra £300,000 has been allocated to pay Holly and Phillip, 57, for their extra thirty minutes of hosting.

The presenting duo are currently paid £600,000 a year for their roles on This Morning after Holly's pay was brought in line with Phillip's in 2017.
